intro: Rajania hastata var. euhastata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rajania, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, lance-shaped leaves that are densely packed along the stem. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a raceme, which bloom during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
